Package shapes3d

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    I_Shape
    You can create a class to represent your own shape.
    SConstants  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Anchor
    As the name suggests this class acts as an Anchor for other shapes.
    BezShape
    A 3D shape generated by a 2D bezier curve in the XY plane being rotated 360 degrees about the Y axis.
    BezTube
    This class represents a tube that follows a Bezier curve in 3D space.
    Box
    A box shape where the length breadth and depth can be set by the user.
    Cone
    A 3D cone shape.
    Ellipsoid
    An ellipsoid is a spherical shape where the radius in the 3 primary directions (x,y,z) are not necessarily the same.
    EndCapContour
    This is the end cap class for all shapes that have open irregular shaped ends e.g.
    Extrusion
    This class represents all shapes that can be created from a 2D contour that moves along a 3D path.
    Helix
    This class represents a helix along the Y axis.
    Mesh2DCore
    Support class providing draw and texture methods for those shapes using a grid mesh.
    ie BezierShape, Ellipsoid, Helix, Toroid, Tube, BezTube and PathTube.
    Mesh2DCoreWithCaps
    This class extends the Mesh2DCore class to enable the use of end caps for the all 3D shapes that have open ends.
    PathTube  
    S3D
    This class is provided to simplify the use of library constants e.g.
    Shape3D
    Abstract class - the base for all 3D shape classes.
    Terrain
    A simple terrain class.
    Toroid
    This class represents a toroid (doughnut / donut shape)
    Although the toroid is circular as viewed from the end, the 'tube' cross-section can be elliptical by setting different radii in the vertical and horizontal directions.
    Tube
    This class represents a tube its length along the y [0,1,0] axis.
    Xshape
    This is a simple way for users to add their own shapes so they work as part of the Shapes3D library.
